meanings.definition: A large accumulated supply of goods or materials, especially one held in reserve for future use.
meanings.sent1: The family had a stockpile of canned food in case of emergencies.
meanings.sent2: The government stored a stockpile of medical supplies for disasters.
meanings.sent3: The stockpile of snacks in the pantry seemed to magically disappear whenever the kids were around.
meanings.sent4: Her collection of books was a stockpile of knowledge waiting to be explored.
meanings.sent5: The stockpile of colorful balloons made the party decorations truly festive.

meanings.definition: To accumulate a stockpile of goods or materials for future use.
meanings.sent1: The squirrel would stockpile acorns for the winter months.
meanings.sent2: She decided to stockpile fabric for her upcoming sewing projects.
meanings.sent3: He would stockpile jokes to impress his friends during gatherings.
meanings.sent4: The student would stockpile study notes to prepare for the exam.
meanings.sent5: The company aimed to stockpile resources to ensure smooth production in the future.
